intro: Viburnum hayatae, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Viburnum hayatae typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and thrives in partial shade to full sun. Its ornamental value lies in its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
